description: The User Search operation searches for users in the portal. The search index is updated whenever users are created, updated, or deleted. There can be a lag between the time that the user is updated and the time when it's reflected in the search results. The results only contain users that the calling user has permissions to see. Users can control this visibility by changing the access property of their user. Care should be taken when using ArcGIS REST API search operations (search, user search, group search) to find items, groups, and users programmatically. The Portal uses a powerful search engine to index information and to allow full text searching on it. This search engine uses many different inputs to find the appropriate results and rank them. This often makes search 'fuzzy', making it ideal for human interaction, but not necessarily ideal for looking for specific records programmatically. Developers should avoid using search to find specific items (e.g. by title) as the results of these types of queries might change as the search engine evolves. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/User_Search/02r3000000m6000000/
title: userSearch

total.description: The total number of results found for the whole query. The number of query results is limited to 10000

start.description: The number of the first entry in the result set for this response. The index number is 1-based

num.description: The number of results included in the result set for this response

nextStart.description: The next entry index if the current result set doesn't contain all results

results.description: A JSON array of user objects. See the response properties for User

created.description: The date the user was created. Shown in UNIX time

culture.description: The item locale information (language and country)

modified.description: The date the user was last modified. Shown in UNIX time

provider.description: The identity provider for the organization. Either arcgis (for built-in users) or enterprise (for external users managed by an enterprise identity store). This was added at Portal for ArcGIS 10.3.1

region.description: The user preferred region, used to set the featured maps on the home page, content in the gallery, and the default extent of new maps in the Viewer

tags.description: User-defined tags that describe the user

thumbnail.description: The file name of the thumbnail used for the user. All user thumbnails are relative to the URL http://<community-url>/users/<userName>/info

username.description: The username of the given user
